tools.name: Create, modify, or delete variables
tools.description: Manages variables, collections, modes, and their values in a Figma file via batch create/update/delete operations; use temporary IDs to link new related items in one request and ensure `variableModeValues` match the target variable's `resolvedType`.

file_key.description: The key of the Figma file or branch to modify variables in. Use `GET /v1/files/:key` with the `branch_data=true` query parameter to obtain a branch key.
file_key.title: File Key

variableCollections.description: List of operations for variable collections, each a dict with 'action' ('CREATE', 'UPDATE', 'DELETE'). For 'CREATE', include 'name' (temp 'id' optional). For 'UPDATE', 'id' and fields to modify. For 'DELETE', 'id'. See Figma API's `VariableCollectionMutation` for details.
variableCollections.title: Variable Collections

variableModeValues.description: A list of specific values to set for variables in particular modes. Each item links a variable and a mode to a new value.
variableModeValues.title: Variable Mode Values

items.description: Request schema for setting a specific value for a variable in a given mode.
items.title: CreateModifyDeleteVariablesvariableModeValuesRequest

modeId.description: The ID of the mode in which to set the variable's value. This mode must belong to the variable collection containing the target variable.
modeId.title: Mode Id

value.description: The value to set for the variable in the specified mode. While this field is typed as boolean in the schema, the actual value provided must match the variable's `resolvedType` (e.g., STRING, FLOAT, COLOR, BOOLEAN). If setting to a variable alias, the alias must also resolve to this type. For non-boolean types, refer to Figma API documentation for the correct value structure if issues arise with this boolean-typed field.
value.title: Value

variableId.description: The ID of the target variable. A temporary ID can be used if the variable is being created in the same request.
variableId.title: Variable Id

variableModes.description: List of operations for modes, each a dict with 'action' ('CREATE', 'UPDATE', 'DELETE'). For 'CREATE', include 'variableCollectionId', 'name' (temp 'id' optional). For 'UPDATE', 'id' and 'name'. For 'DELETE', 'id'. See Figma API's `VariableModeMutation` for details.
variableModes.title: Variable Modes

variables.description: List of operations for variables, each a dict with 'action' ('CREATE', 'UPDATE', 'DELETE'). For 'CREATE', include 'variableCollectionId', 'name', 'resolvedType' (temp 'id' optional). For 'UPDATE', 'id' and fields to modify. For 'DELETE', 'id'. See Figma API's `VariableMutation` for details.
variables.title: Variables

tools.name: Discover Figma Resources
tools.description: üîç Smart Figma resource discovery - never guess IDs again! üéØ EASIEST METHOD: Just paste any Figma URL to get all IDs: ‚Ä¢ File URLs: https://www.figma.com/file/ABC123/Design ‚Üí get file_key ‚Ä¢ Design URLs: https://www.figma.com/design/ABC123/Design ‚Üí get file_key ‚Ä¢ Node URLs: ...?node-id=123:456 ‚Üí get file_key + node_id ‚Ä¢ Team URLs: .../team/123456/... ‚Üí get team_id üîÑ STEP-BY-STEP DISCOVERY: 1. team_id ‚Üí projects list (with project IDs) 2. project_id ‚Üí files list (with file keys + thumbnails) 3. file_key ‚Üí nodes list (with node IDs + hierarchy) üí° COMMON WORKFLOWS: ‚Ä¢ Extract from URL: DiscoverFigmaResources(figma_url="...") ‚Ä¢ Browse team: DiscoverFigmaResources(team_id="123") ‚Ä¢ List files: DiscoverFigmaResources(project_id="proj_456") ‚Ä¢ Find nodes: DiscoverFigmaResources(file_key="ABC123") ‚ú® Get file_key for GetFileJson, node IDs for DetectBackground, etc.

figma_url.description:
Full Figma URL to extract file_key, node_id, and team_id from. Works with any Figma URL format:
‚Ä¢ File: https://www.figma.com/file/ABC123/Design-Name
‚Ä¢ Design: https://www.figma.com/design/ABC123/Design-Name
‚Ä¢ With node: https://www.figma.com/file/ABC123/Design?node-id=123:456
‚Ä¢ Team: https://www.figma.com/files/team/123456/Team-Name
This is the easiest way to get all IDs you need!
figma_url.title: Figma Url

file_key.description: File key to extract all node IDs from. Get this from file URL (figma.com/file/FILE_KEY/...) or from project files list. Returns hierarchical list of all nodes with IDs, names, types, and paths.
file_key.title: File Key

max_depth.description: Maximum tree depth to traverse when discovering nodes. 2=pages+frames, 3=pages+frames+components, etc. Higher values find more nodes but take longer.
max_depth.title: Max Depth

project_id.description: Project ID to list all files from. Get this from project URL or from team projects list. Returns files with keys, names, and thumbnails.
project_id.title: Project Id

team_id.description: Team ID to list all projects from. Get this from team URL: https://www.figma.com/files/team/YOUR_TEAM_ID/Team-Name. Returns list of projects with IDs and names.

tools.name: Get comments in a file
tools.description: Retrieves all comments from an existing Figma file, identified by a valid `file_key`, returning details like content, author, position, and reactions, with an option for Markdown formatted content.

as_md.description: If true, comment content will be returned in Markdown format where applicable (e.g., for links, bold text). Defaults to false, returning rich text structure.
as_md.title: As Md

inputParameters.title: GetCommentsInAFileRequest
inputParameters.description: Request schema for `GetCommentsInAFile` action. Specifies the file and formatting options for retrieving comments.

data.description: Wrapper object containing the list of comments.

comments.description: A list of comment objects retrieved from the Figma file.
comments.title: Comments

client_meta.description:
Positioning data for the comment, detailing its location and type (point or region) on the canvas. The structure of this field varies based on how the comment is placed:
- `ClientMeta`: Absolute canvas coordinates (x, y) for a point comment.
- `ClientMeta1`: Node-relative offset (`node_id`, `node_offset`) for a point comment.
- `ClientMeta2`: Absolute canvas coordinates (`x`, `y` for an anchor corner), region dimensions (`region_width`, `region_height`), and `comment_pin_corner` for a region comment.
- `ClientMeta3`: Node-relative offset (`node_id`, `node_offset` for an anchor corner), region dimensions, and `comment_pin_corner` for a region comment.
client_meta.title: ClientMeta

x.description: The X coordinate of a vector, typically representing an absolute position on the Figma canvas.
x.title: X

y.description: The Y coordinate of a vector, typically representing an absolute position on the Figma canvas.
y.title: Y

created_at.description: Timestamp in UTC ISO 8601 format indicating when the comment was created.
created_at.title: Created At

file_key.description: Identifier of the Figma file containing this comment.
file_key.title: File Key

id.description: Unique identifier for the comment.
id.title: Id

message.description: The text content of the comment. May include mentions or rich text elements if `as_md` is false, or Markdown content if `as_md` is true.
message.title: Message

order_id.description: A string representing the numerical identifier (e.g., '1', '2') displayed with the comment in the Figma UI. This is typically present only for top-level comments and reflects their visible ordering.
order_id.title: Order Id

parent_id.description: Identifier of the parent comment if this comment is a reply. Null or absent for top-level comments.
parent_id.title: Parent Id

reactions.description: A list of all reactions made to this comment.
reactions.title: Reactions

created_at.description: Timestamp in UTC ISO 8601 format indicating when the reaction was added.
created_at.title: Created At

id.title: Id

group_by.description: Dimension by which to group the library style analytics data.

tools.name: Get payments
tools.description: Retrieves a user's payment information for a Figma plugin, widget, or Community file; the authenticated identity must own the resource.

community_file_id.description: ID of the Community file. Obtain from its Community page URL (number after 'file/'). If `user_id` is provided, specify exactly one of `community_file_id`, `plugin_id`, or `widget_id`.
community_file_id.title: Community File Id

plugin_id.description: ID of the plugin. Obtain from its manifest or Community page URL (number after 'plugin/'). If `user_id` is provided, specify exactly one of `community_file_id`, `plugin_id`, or `widget_id`.
plugin_id.title: Plugin Id

plugin_payment_token.description: Short-lived auth token from `getPluginPaymentTokenAsync` (Figma Plugin Payments API). See Figma docs 'Calling the Payments REST API...'. If provided, `user_id` and resource IDs are typically not needed.
plugin_payment_token.title: Plugin Payment Token

user_id.description: ID of the user whose payment information is sought. Obtain via OAuth2 with Figma REST API. Required if `plugin_payment_token` is not provided.
user_id.title: User Id

widget_id.description: ID of the widget. Obtain from its manifest or Community page URL (number after 'widget/'). If `user_id` is provided, specify exactly one of `community_file_id`, `plugin_id`, or `widget_id`.
widget_id.title: Widget Id

inputParameters.title: GetPaymentsRequest
inputParameters.description: Request schema for `GetPayments`

data.description: Contains the detailed payment information for the user and resource, including status, error, and metadata.
data.title: Data

error.description: For successful requests, this value is always `false`.
error.title: Error

meta.description: An object describing a user's payment information for a plugin, widget, or Community file.
meta.title: Meta

date_of_purchase.description:
The UTC ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the user purchased the resource. No value is given if the user has never purchased the resource.
  
Note that a value will still be returned if the user had purchased the resource, but no longer has active access to it (e.g. purchase refunded, subscription ended).
date_of_purchase.title: Date Of Purchase

payment_status.description: An object describing the user's payment status.
payment_status.title: Payment Status

type.description:
The current payment status of the user on the resource, as a string enum:
  
- `UNPAID`: user has not paid for the resource
- `PAID`: user has an active purchase on the resource
- `TRIAL`: user is in the trial period for a subscription resource
type.title: Type

resource_id.description: ID of the queried plugin, widget, or Community file. Can be used for response validation.
resource_id.title: Resource Id

user_id.description: ID of the user whose payment information was queried. Can be used for response validation.
user_id.title: User Id

status.description: The response status code.
status.title: Status

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Render images of file nodes
tools.description: Renders specified nodes from a Figma file as images (JPG, PDF, PNG, SVG), returning a map of node IDs to image URLs (or `null` for failed nodes); images expire after 30 days and are capped at 32 megapixels (larger requests are scaled down).

contents_only.description: If true, excludes content overlapping node boundaries. If false, includes overlapping content (may increase processing time).
contents_only.title: Contents Only

file_key.description: Key of the Figma file or branch. To obtain a branch key, use the `GET /v1/files/:key` endpoint with the `branch_data=true` query parameter.
file_key.title: File Key

format.description: Desired output format for the rendered images.
format.title: Format

ids.description: Comma-separated list of node IDs to render as images (e.g., '1:2,1:3,1:4').
ids.title: Ids

scale.description: Image scaling factor, a number between 0.01 and 4 (e.g., 2 renders at twice original size).
scale.title: Scale

svg_include_id.description: (SVG format only) If true, includes `id` attributes (using layer name) for all SVG elements.
svg_include_id.title: Svg Include Id

svg_include_node_id.description: (SVG format only) If true, includes `data-node-id` attribute (with node ID) for all SVG elements.
svg_include_node_id.title: Svg Include Node Id

svg_outline_text.description: (SVG format only) If true, text is rendered as vector paths (outlines) for visual fidelity. If false, text is rendered as `<text>` elements (selectable, appearance may vary).
svg_outline_text.title: Svg Outline Text

svg_simplify_stroke.description: (SVG format only) If true, simplifies inside/outside strokes, using `stroke` attribute instead of `<mask>` where possible.
svg_simplify_stroke.title: Svg Simplify Stroke

use_absolute_bounds.description: If true, uses full node dimensions for rendering, ignoring cropping/empty space (useful for text nodes without unintended cropping).
use_absolute_bounds.title: Use Absolute Bounds

version.description: Specific version ID of the file to render; if omitted, the current version is used.
version.title: Version

inputParameters.title: RenderImagesOfFileNodesRequest
inputParameters.description: Request model for rendering images of specified nodes within a Figma file.

data.description: Core response data with image rendering results.
data.title: Data

err.description: Always `null` if overall request was successful. Check `images` map for node-specific rendering status.
err.title: Err

images.description: Maps each requested node ID to its rendered image URL. A `null` value signifies rendering failure for that node (e.g., ID non-existent, node unrenderable). All input `ids` are present as keys.
images.title: Images

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful
